posts.post_content:
This card is simply amazing. A 5/3 for five mana (super-splashable too) isn't horrible, but the abilities just make it crazy. This guy will be perfect in Birthing Pod decks, he'll be great with Conjurer's Closet, and he makes Vapor Snag users cower in fear.  
  
5/5. This is what green should be.

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (7/5/2012 4:14:53 PM)
Rating:

@majinara
What you're forgetting is that he doesn't drop a token when he dies. He drops a token when he leaves the battlefield. Critical distinction.
Recent cards are all about flicker mechanics, with Cloudshift being a perfect example. Sure, if you play Thragtusk like it's a crappy version of Penumbra Wurm, he will be a crappy version of Penumbra Wurm. But once he's on the board, every time an effect causes him to flicker you get a 3/3 token and 5 more life. Cloudshift is the cheapest, letting you drop tokens and gain life for W, but if you're really nasty you can Soulbond this guy to a Deadeye Navigator to flicker him an arbitrary number of times at 1U each.

posts.post_content:
They could have at least put "dies" clause. As is, hes extremely efficient against exile, destroy, wrath, and bounce. If they drop [cavern of souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cavern of souls) (which a lot of non tribal decks run x4), then hes a control decks worst nightmare.   
  
So whats left is the seldom used [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism) / [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control) type cards, and stuff like [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone).  
  
Not to mention a simple [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift) makes this card get really out of hand. I am sorry, I feel this was a mistake.  
  
If your running creature-less, there is no real way to trade 1 card for 1 card. You really don't want to use auras, or you will get stomped to flicker type things.  
  
@canucks   
Read my post. 2 for 1 is terrible, and all of those suggestions still leave them with a 3/3 rancor treat.  
  
@MoxSapphire  
Well worth the $80 price-tag? That statement proves this card is overpowered and poorly designed. But you seem like the type of player that abuses developers mi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Hakkology (10/30/2012 3:08:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is stupidly good because of the meta it was brought about in. And I do mean "stupidly". I know they really wanted to push the blink mechanic but in the process they created a standard warping monster. Most decks at the moment are either midrange that utilizes this, Control that tries to stop it from being played, or Zombies which tries to minimize its impact. Gaining 5 life slows down most aggro decks for you to be able to set up your wincon (if this dude isn't it already). The 3/3 beast is really just a chump blocker, but you get it when it *leaves the battlefield*. Not dies. If it hits, there is no way to get rid of it without it making the token. That means you can drop any boardwipe of your choice and get instant board advantage. That paired with easy splashing, aggressive power and a toughness that keeps it out of reach of Pillar of Flame makes this one of the most pivotal cards in standard at the moment. Unless Gatecrash has an easy was to counter activated abiliti... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
